subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Islam and Democracy: Compatible or Not?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Islam and Democracy: Compatible or Not?.

hook.text: Can Islam and democracy coexist? Turkey, Indonesia, and Tunisia say yes. Iran and Saudi Arabia are less sure.

buildup.text: Critics argue Islam demands theocracy. The Quran is God's law, so human legislation is secondary or irrelevant.

discovery.text: But 'shura' (consultation) is a Quranic principle. Many scholars argue Islam's values align with democratic governance.

twist.text: Indonesia, the largest Muslim country, is a democracy. The 'Islam vs. democracy' debate ignores a billion Muslims.

climax.text: The question isn't whether Islam allows democracy. It's whether power structures allow it. Religion is often the excuse.

punchline.text: Indonesia proves Islam and democracy work together. A billion Muslims agree.

quiz.question: What Quranic principle aligns with democratic governance?
